medical_history.chief_complaint: Familial Ebstein’s anomaly, left ventricular noncompaction, and ventricular septal defect.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The proband presented at 4 days of age with a precordial systolic murmur, became symptomatic at 11 days of age with feeding difficulties, pallor, poor perfusion, tachypnea, and tachycardia. She underwent repairs for atrial septal defect and VSD at 16 days and for coarctation of the aorta at 1 month, but her symptoms did not improve. The brother became symptomatic at 5 days with tachypnea and tachycardia, undergoing VSD repair at 1 month.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both siblings have diagnosed Ebstein’s anomaly, left ventricular noncompaction, and ventricular septal defect.
medical_history.family_history: The father also has left ventricular noncompaction, and both siblings have a novel MYH7 mutation associated with the conditions.
